the Library of Virginia 52842

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Miscellaneous Genealogical Notes Collection No. 26., 2009
did.origination: Virginia Daughters of the American Revolution

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Miscellaneous Genealogical Notes Collection No. 26. Accession 52842. Genealogical notes collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Virginia Daughters of the American Revolution

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes Bible records, cemetery records, death records, genealogies, land records, marriage records, obituaries, and wills relating to the following families: Allemang, Brooks, Brown, Clark, Coble, Coleman, Deems, Dickinson, Embrey, Fogleman, Graves, Hageloch, Horn, Irwin, Isley, Lay, Lilly, Logan, Loyd, Martin, McBroom, Morrison, Nunns, Osborne, Pemberton, Reed Stafford, Streit, Thomas, and Ware. Localities covered include: Fauquier and Spotsylvania Counties, and Alexandria and Winchester, Virginia; and Germany, Illinois, Maryland, Mississippi, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Texas, and West Virginia. Includes biographical information on John C. Pemberton (1814-1881) and historical information on Andrews Tavern, Spotsylvania County. Includes index.

did.unittitle: Front material (3 pages)
Copiah County, Mississippi marriage bonds, 1831(pp. 1-3)
The Nunns family of New York City (pp. 4-43)
Allemang, Horn Logan, Clark family Bible record (Adams, Highland, and Pike Counties, Ohio), 1781-1958 (pp. 44-59)
Irwin, Osborne, Ware families marriage records, obituaries, (Fayette, Montgomery, and Sangamon Counties, Illinois), 1832-1931 (pp. 60-76)
Hageloch family Bible record (Germany), 1806-1897 (pp. 77-80)
Irwin, McBroom families marriage records (Sangamon County, Illinois), 1897 (pp. 81-83)
Martin family genealogical notes (Rochester, New York) (pp. 84-95)
Brooks, Brown, Embrey families genealogical notes (Fauquier County, Virginia) (pp. 96-175)
McBroom, Osborne families marriage records, death records, petition (Montgomery and Shelby Counties, Illinois), 1854-1927 (pp. 176-183)
Deems family death records (Alexandria, Virginia), 1946-1954 (pp. 184-185)
Lay, Lilly families marriage records, death records (Baltimore, Maryland), 1900-1932 (pp. 186-188)
Graves, Isley families, genealogical notes (Orange County, North Carolina) (pp. 189-207)
Monongalia, Monroe, and Pendleton Counties, West Virginia, marriage records, 1807-1880 (pp. 208-221)
Fogleman, Graves, Isley, Stafford, Coble families marriage records, death record (Guilford and Orange Counties, North Carolina, and Baltimore, Maryland), 1806-1898 (222-235 pp.)
Reed family death records, will (Monroe and Monongalia Counties, West Virginia), 1845-1893 (pp. 236-238)
Coble family wills (Orange County, North Carolina), 1846 (pp. 239-240)
Reed, Osborne, McBroom, Ware, Irwin families genealogical notes (Champaign and Montgomery Counties, Illinois), (pp. 241-263)
Upshur County, Texas land records, 1850-1907 (pp. 264-303)
Morrison, Thomas, Pemberton, Loyd, Dickinson, families genealogical notes (Spotsylvania County, Virginia) (pp. 304-327)
Streit family genealogical notes (pp. 328-334)
Dickinson, Coleman families Bible records, obituaries (Spotsylvania County, Virginia) 1804-1967 (pp. 335-345)
Andrews Tavern (Spotsylvania County, Virginia) (pp. 346-359)
John C. Pemberton (pp. 360-363)
Index (26 p.)
